content: in these uncertain times i would like to gift you this pattern hopefully it will bring you comfort and provide a calming distraction as we navigate this uncharted path together magic tiles is knit modular this means the squares are knitted together by picking up and knitting stitches from the previously worked square this also means no sewing the blanket can be made any size with any weight yarn it can be a planned or random layout you can use one colour two colours or a variety each square uses approx 11 m/12 yds of yarn making it the perfect project for leftovers as we self-isolate and are unable to be with our loved ones knit a square in their favourite colour or use yarn leftover from something you made for them one day at a time one square at a time we will make it may you and your loved ones stay safe suitable for an experienced beginner techniques to explore knitted cast on cable cast on central double decrease picking up and knitting sts i-cord border features provisional cast on and kitchener stitch to join please note as a knitting instructor i have used this detail-oriented pattern in the classroom for the past 14 years i converted the workbook to a pattern for publication on ravelry but it has not been professionally tech edited errata getting started square a - after cable casting on 35 sts it is not necessary to turn to work the set up row
